metadata.title: CVE-2020-12755 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
fishProtocol::establishConnection in fish/fish.cpp in KDE kio-extrasthrough 20.04.0 makes a cacheAuthentication call even if the user had notset the keepPassword option. This may lead to unintended KWallet storage ofa password.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12755` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kio-extras - 4:20.08.3-1
kio-extras-data - 4:20.08.3-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: kio-extras package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:20.08.3-1').
